column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=I.
#Text=The Light in the Window
#Text=A rickety carriage was slowly ascending the hill , and from the place of honour on the back seat , the single passenger surveyed the country with interest and admiration .

#Text=The driver of that ancient chariot was an awkward young fellow , possibly twenty-five years of age , with sharp knees , large , red hands , high cheek-bones , and abundant hair of a shade verging upon orange .
#Text=He was not unpleasant to look upon , however , for he had a certain evident honesty , and he was disposed to be friendly to every one .
#Text=“ Be you comfortable , Miss ? ” he asked , with apparent solicitude .
#Text=“ Very comfortable , thank you , ” was the quiet response .
#Text=He urged his venerable steeds to a gait of about two miles an hour , then turned sideways .
#Text=“ Be you goin ' to stay long , Miss ? ”
#Text=“ All Summer , I think . ”
#Text=“ Do tell ! ”
#Text=The young woman smiled in listless amusement , but Joe took it for conversational encouragement .
#Text=“ City folks is dretful bashful when they 's away from home , ” he said to himself .
#Text=He clucked again to his unheeding horses , shifted his quid , and was casting about for a new topic when a light broke in upon him .
#Text=“ I guess , now , that you 're Miss Hathaway 's niece , what 's come to stay in her house while she goes gallivantin ' and travellin ' in furrin parts , be n't you ? ”
#Text=“ I am Miss Hathaway 's niece , and I have never been here before .
#Text=Where does she live ? ”
#Text=“ Up yander . ”
#Text=He flourished the discarded fish-pole which served as a whip , and pointed out a small white house on the brow of the hill .
#Text=Reflection brought him the conviction that his remark concerning Miss Hathaway was a social mistake , since his passenger sat very straight , and asked no more questions .
#Text=The weary wheels creaked , but the collapse which Miss Thorne momentarily expected was mercifully postponed .
#Text=Being gifted with imagination , she experienced the emotion of a wreck without bodily harm .

#Text=As in a photograph , she beheld herself suddenly projected into space , followed by her suit case , felt her new hat wrenched from her head , and saw hopeless gravel stains upon the tailored gown which was the pride of her heart .
#Text=She thought a sprained ankle would be the inevitable outcome of the fall , but was spared the pain of it , for the inability to realise an actual hurt is the redeeming feature of imagination .
#Text=Suddenly there was a snort of terror from one of the horses , and the carriage stopped abruptly .
#Text=Ruth clutched her suit case and umbrella , instantly prepared for the worst ; but Joe reassured her .
#Text=“ Now do n't you go and get skeered , Miss , ” he said , kindly ; “ ' taint nothin ' in the world but a rabbit .
#Text=Mamie ca n't never get used to rabbits , someways . ”
#Text=He indicated one of the horses -- a high , raw-boned animal , sketched on a generous plan , whose ribs and joints protruded , and whose rough white coat had been weather-worn to grey .
#Text=“ Hush now , Mamie , ” he said ; “ ' taint nothin ' . ”
#Text=“ Mamie ” looked around inquiringly , with one ear erect and the other at an angle .
#Text=A cataract partially concealed one eye , but in the other was a world of wickedness and knowledge , modified by a certain lady-like reserve .
#Text=“ G ' long , Mamie ! ”
#Text=Ruth laughed as the horse resumed motion in mincing , maidenly steps .
#Text=“ What 's the other one 's name ? ” she asked .
#Text=“ Him ?
#Text=His name 's Alfred .
#Text=Mamie 's his mother . ”
#Text=Miss Thorne endeavoured to conceal her amusement and Joe was pleased because the ice was broken .
#Text=“ I change their names every once in a while , ” he said , “ ' cause it makes some variety , but now I 've named 'em about all the names I know . ”
#Text=The road wound upward in its own lazy fashion , and there were trees at the left , though only one or two shaded the hill itself .
#Text=As they approached the summit , a girl in a blue gingham dress and a neat white apron came out to meet them .
#Text=“ Come right in , Miss Thorne , ” she said , “ and I 'll explain it to you . ”
#Text=Ruth descended , inwardly vowing that she would ride no more in Joe 's carriage , and after giving some directions about her trunk , followed her guide indoors .
#Text=The storm-beaten house was certainly entitled to the respect accorded to age .
#Text=It was substantial , but unpretentious in outline , and had not been painted for a long time .

#Text=The faded green shutters blended harmoniously with the greyish white background , and the piazza , which was evidently an unhappy afterthought of the architect , had two or three new shingles on its roof .

#Text=“ You see it 's this way , Miss Thorne , ” the maid began , volubly ; “ Miss Hathaway , she went earlier than she laid out to , on account of the folks decidin ' to take a steamer that sailed beforehand -- before the other one , I mean .
#Text=She went in sech a hurry that she did n't have time to send you word and get an answer , but she 's left a letter here for you , for she trusted to your comin ' . ”
#Text=Miss Thorne laid her hat and jacket aside and settled herself comfortably in a rocker .

#Text=The maid returned presently with a letter which Miss Hathaway had sealed with half an ounce of red wax , presumably in a laudable effort to remove temptation from the path of the red-cheeked , wholesome , farmer 's daughter who stood near by with her hands on her hips .
#Text=“ Miss Ruth Thorne , ” the letter began ,
#Text=“ Dear Niece :
#Text=“ I am writing this in a hurry , as we are going a week before we expected to .
#Text=I think you will find everything all right .
#Text=Hepsey will attend to the house-keeping , for I do n't suppose you know much about it , coming from the city .
#Text=She 's a good-hearted girl , but she 's set in her ways , and you 'll have to kinder give in to her , but any time when you ca n't , just speak to her sharp and she 'll do as you tell her .
